metadata.Title: CVE-2016-8683 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The ReadPCXImage function in coders/pcx.c in GraphicsMagick 1.3.25 allows remote attackers to have unspecified impact via a crafted image, which triggers a memory allocation failure and a "file truncation error for corrupt file." It was discovered that GraphicsMagick incorrectly handled certain image files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8683` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.25-5
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.25-5
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.25-5
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.3.25-5
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.3.25-5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.25-5').
